newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Pasminco 1st qtr below year earlier.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Pasminco 1st qtr below year earlier.

text.p: Australian lead and zinc miner Pasminco Ltd said on Tuesday that its first quarter results were below results for the same period a year earlier.

"In the first quarter, our result - financial performance - is below last year because of the impact of the (Australian) dollar," chief executive David Stewart told reporters after the annual meeting.
For every one cent rise in the value of the Australian dollar against the greenback, Pasminco suffers a A$7.5 million fall in after-tax profit, Stewart said.
The Australian dollar on average was five cents stronger in the first quarter of 1996/97 than its average for all of 1995/96, he added.

Stewart declined to quantify the fall in first-quarter profit compared with last year, but said cost cutting and higher productivity had partially offset the impact of the firmer local currency during the period.
"We are going to have a diffcult year," he said.
Pasminco reported a net profit after abnormals of A$40.8 million for the year to June 30, up from A$12.2 million a year earlier.
